metadata.description: Encode a sentence in English into Pig Latin
metadata.task_prefix: Pig Latin looks just like English, but if an English word starts with a vowel you add -yay at the end of the word (ice -> iceyay); if it starts with consonants, you move them to end of the word and add -ay (prank -> ankpray); if it is capitalized, the Pig Latin word is capitalized as well (Maggie -> Aggiemay). Translate English into Pig Latin.

2.input: I think that you know which one I like better.
2.output: Iay inkthay atthay ouyay owknay ichwhay oneay Iay ikelay etterbay.

3.input: Tom is not a morning person.
3.output: Omtay isay otnay ay orningmay ersonpay.

4.input: Can you have it both ways?
4.output: Ancay ouyay avehay itay othbay aysway?

6.input: I had to give a speech.
6.output: Iay adhay otay ivegay ay eechspay.

7.input: He wants to learn to be at peace with himself.
7.output: Ehay antsway otay earnlay otay ebay atay eacepay ithway imselfhay.

8.input: When did you find out Tom had been in prison?
8.output: Enwhay idday ouyay indfay outay Omtay adhay eenbay inay isonpray?

9.input: Tom did a lot of laundry today.
9.output: Omtay idday ay otlay ofay aundrylay odaytay.

10.input: Let this be an example to you.
10.output: Etlay isthay ebay anay exampleay otay ouyay.

11.input: Tom told the judge he wanted a different lawyer.
11.output: Omtay oldtay ethay udgejay ehay antedway ay ifferentday awyerlay.

13.input: The town laid buried for centuries.
13.output: Ethay owntay aidlay uriedbay orfay enturiescay.

14.input: Tom is twice as heavy as I am.
14.output: Omtay isay icetway asay eavyhay asay Iay amay.

15.input: She drinks lemon juice every morning.
15.output: Eshay inksdray emonlay uicejay everyay orningmay.

17.input: He just carried out the sentence.
17.output: Ehay ustjay arriedcay outay ethay entencesay.

21.input: The birds in the cage are canaries.
21.output: Ethay irdsbay inay ethay agecay areay anariescay.

22.input: Tom is a part of the team.
22.output: Omtay isay ay artpay ofay ethay eamtay.

23.input: Bad weather kept us from going out.
23.output: Adbay eatherway eptkay usay omfray oinggay outay.

24.input: I had to stay in Boston.
24.output: Iay adhay otay aystay inay Ostonbay.

27.input: I take a taxi to the train station once or twice a week.
27.output: Iay aketay ay axitay otay ethay aintray ationstay onceay oray icetway ay eekway.

29.input: They risked their lives for us.
29.output: Eythay iskedray eirthay iveslay orfay usay.

32.input: Hitler was one of the most infamous dictators.
32.output: Itlerhay asway oneay ofay ethay ostmay infamousay ictatorsday.

33.input: I thought that Tom would be happy to do that.
33.output: Iay oughtthay atthay Omtay ouldway ebay appyhay otay oday atthay.

34.input: There is currently no killer app for this platform.
34.output: Erethay isay urrentlycay onay illerkay appay orfay isthay atformplay.

35.input: Who wants to ask a question?
35.output: Owhay antsway otay askay ay uestionqay?

37.input: He is very afraid of his father.
37.output: Ehay isay eryvay afraiday ofay ishay atherfay.

38.input: Jane has been acting in movies since she was eleven.
38.output: Anejay ashay eenbay actingay inay oviesmay incesay eshay asway elevenay.

39.input: Did they agree to our terms?
39.output: Idday eythay agreeay otay ouray ermstay?

40.input: I just realized there are many more pages that I thought.
40.output: Iay ustjay ealizedray erethay areay anymay oremay agespay atthay Iay oughtthay.

42.input: The birds flew south in search of warmth.
42.output: Ethay irdsbay ewflay outhsay inay earchsay ofay armthway.

44.input: Mary is doing what she loves.
44.output: Arymay isay oingday atwhay eshay oveslay.

45.input: She suggested that we have a farewell party for him.
45.output: Eshay uggestedsay atthay eway avehay ay arewellfay artypay orfay imhay.

46.input: I think Tom is much friendlier than Mary is.
46.output: Iay inkthay Omtay isay uchmay iendlierfray anthay Arymay isay.

47.input: Mennad never told Baya about his nose job.
47.output: Ennadmay evernay oldtay Ayabay aboutay ishay osenay objay.

52.input: The true wisdom of life consists in seeing the miraculous in the common.
52.output: Ethay uetray isdomway ofay ifelay onsistscay inay eeingsay ethay iraculousmay inay ethay ommoncay.

53.input: Sami will grow up one day and he will make decisions.
53.output: Amisay illway owgray upay oneay ayday anday ehay illway akemay ecisionsday.

54.input: Tom is sorry that he did that.
54.output: Omtay isay orrysay atthay ehay idday atthay.

55.input: People I admire most are those who do not see life in terms of power.
55.output: Eoplepay Iay admireay ostmay areay osethay owhay oday otnay eesay ifelay inay ermstay ofay owerpay.

57.input: Guarani is one of the two official languages of Paraguay.
57.output: Uaranigay isay oneay ofay ethay otway officialay anguageslay ofay Araguaypay.

58.input: The police are certain to get him in the end wherever he may go.
58.output: Ethay olicepay areay ertaincay otay etgay imhay inay ethay enday ereverwhay ehay aymay ogay.

59.input: Tom knew Mary would be obstinate.
59.output: Omtay ewknay Arymay ouldway ebay obstinateay.

60.input: Mary told me that she was very busy.
60.output: Arymay oldtay emay atthay eshay asway eryvay usybay.

61.input: I suspect Tom will be back soon.
61.output: Iay uspectsay Omtay illway ebay ackbay oonsay.

62.input: They all interpreted the presence of that owl as an ominous premonition.
62.output: Eythay allay interpreteday ethay esencepray ofay atthay owlay asay anay ominousay emonitionpray.

63.input: I want to go to a land without Mondays.
63.output: Iay antway otay ogay otay ay andlay ithoutway Ondaysmay.

64.input: Tom thought that he could pull a fast one.
64.output: Omtay oughtthay atthay ehay ouldcay ullpay ay astfay oneay.

66.input: Tell me right now who that was and what they were looking for!
66.output: Elltay emay ightray ownay owhay atthay asway anday atwhay eythay ereway ookinglay orfay!

68.input: I wanted to discuss that subject with you.
68.output: Iay antedway otay iscussday atthay ubjectsay ithway ouyay.

69.input: Sami and Layla knew the same people.
69.output: Amisay anday Aylalay ewknay ethay amesay eoplepay.

71.input: I am in a hotel in Algiers.
71.output: Iay amay inay ay otelhay inay Algiersay.

72.input: I hear you went to Harvard.
72.output: Iay earhay ouyay entway otay Arvardhay.

74.input: You ought to have started half an hour ago.
74.output: Ouyay oughtay otay avehay artedstay alfhay anay ourhay agoay.

75.input: His mom puts up with all of his mischief.
75.output: Ishay ommay utspay upay ithway allay ofay ishay ischiefmay.

77.input: Tom and Mary were swimming laps.
77.output: Omtay anday Arymay ereway immingsway apslay.

78.input: At least thirty people died in the riots.
78.output: Atay eastlay irtythay eoplepay iedday inay ethay iotsray.

79.input: She knows nothing about your family.
79.output: Eshay owsknay othingnay aboutay ouryay amilyfay.

81.input: I know that Tom is a better drummer than Mary.
81.output: Iay owknay atthay Omtay isay ay etterbay ummerdray anthay Arymay.

83.input: Tom and Mary are really drunk.
83.output: Omtay anday Arymay areay eallyray unkdray.

85.input: I always knew that was what you wanted.
85.output: Iay alwaysay ewknay atthay asway atwhay ouyay antedway.

86.input: Tom forgot to bring a flashlight.
86.output: Omtay orgotfay otay ingbray ay ashlightflay.

87.input: Tom threw a big party at his house while his parents were on vacation.
87.output: Omtay ewthray ay igbay artypay atay ishay ousehay ilewhay ishay arentspay ereway onay acationvay.

88.input: I printed many copies of the insurance contract.
88.output: Iay intedpray anymay opiescay ofay ethay insuranceay ontractcay.

89.input: I knew this day would come.
89.output: Iay ewknay isthay ayday ouldway omecay.

91.input: A living statue rests on a bench and two statues of liberty talk with tourists.
91.output: A living statue rests on a bench and two statues of liberty talk with tourists.

92.input: Tom got fired for doing that.
92.output: Tom got fired for doing that.

93.input: I was happy to buy that for you.
93.output: I was happy to buy that for you.

94.input: Do you have the letter with you?
94.output: Do you have the letter with you?

95.input: Do you think Tom might be cold?
95.output: Do you think Tom might be cold?

96.input: I have no reason to lie to you.
96.output: I have no reason to lie to you.

97.input: I go to Australia three or four times a year.
97.output: I go to Australia three or four times a year.

100.input: We came pretty close to being involved in that accident.
100.output: We came pretty close to being involved in that accident.
